data.title: Official Website of Allegiant Stadium
data.meta_description: Allegiant Stadium's A-Z Guide helps to provide information and answers to questions about attending events at the stadium.
data.text:
Allegiant Stadium and the Las Vegas Raiders are committed to providing a first-class experience for all of our guests, including guests with disabilities. Allegiant Stadium is accessible by guests with disabilities and dedicated team members are available to work with you in order to provide reasonable accommodations for your visit at Allegiant Stadium. To speak with someone regarding accommodations, assistance, or questions prior to your visit, please contact our Guest Experience department at guestexperience@raiders.com.

Entry: Guests with disabilities may enter the stadium via an accessible entry lane.

Tickets: ADA accessible seating is available throughout Allegiant Stadium as depicted in the seating chart below. Tickets for accessible seating at Allegiant Stadium are available on TICKETMASTER.COM – the official ticketing partner of the Raiders and Allegiant Stadium.

Allegiant Stadium provides ADA seating areas comprised of accessible locations with immediately adjacent companion seating. Subject to availability, guests requiring accessible seating may purchase up to a total of three (3) companion seats in the same row and contiguous with the accessible seat. If contiguous seats have already been sold, seats as close as possible to the accessible seat will be offered, if available. If the overall ticket limit is less than four (4) tickets per person for an event, then the lower ticket limit applies.

If you purchased a ticket in the fixed seating area but require an accessible seat, Guest Experience staff may be able to assist you by relocating your ticket to an ADA seating area. All relocations are provided on a first-come-first-served basis and are not guaranteed. Please contact the Box Office should you have any questions or require any assistance purchasing tickets. Tickets are subject to availability.

ADA Seating Chart

Event Day: For event day assistance or questions regarding accessibility services at Allegiant Stadium, please visit a Guest Experience location where a teammate can assist you. If you have additional questions, contact Allegiant Stadium directly by emailing guestexperience@raiders.com.

Listening Devices: Please see A-Z Guide section titled ASSISTIVE LISTENING DEVICES.

Parking: For parking information, please visit DIRECTIONS & PARKING.

Courtesy Shuttles: For additional information about shuttle services for guests with disabilities and other mobility impairments, please see A-Z Guide section titled COURTESY SHUTTLES.

Sensory Processing: Please see A-Z Guide section titled SENSORY KITS AND NOOKS.

Service Animals: Please see A-Z Guide section titled ANIMALS.

Sign Language / Interpreter: Please see A-Z Guide section titled INTERPRETER.

Wheelchairs: Please see A-Z Guide section titled WHEELCHAIRS.

Email Guest Experience ADA Seating Chart

Help us create a safe and friendly environment for all guests at Allegiant Stadium!

We expect all who enter Allegiant Stadium and the surrounding parking lots to adhere to this Code. Failure to follow this Code may result in denial of entry, ejection, revocation of ticket privileges, and/or arrest all without any refund. Personal Seat License Members have the right to sell or transfer tickets through verified channels. Personal Seat License Members transferring or selling tickets on non-verified platforms will be held responsible for the actions of those using their tickets.

The following actions are violations of the guest Code of Conduct:

Fighting, taunting, instigating, inciting, or encouraging any action that may harm, endanger, threaten, or bring discomfort to anyone.

Use of foul, abusive, or obscene language and/or gestures, including the use of language or gestures concerning a person’s race, ethnicity, color, gender, religion, creed, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression or national origin.

Any action that is illegal, unruly, causes a disruption, creates an unsafe environment, or interferes with the event, including throwing or dropping any object on the field or performance area, entering restricted areas, or any conduct deemed inappropriate or dangerous to fans, players, participants, officials, or stadium staff.

Actions that impair others’ ability to enjoy the event, including mistreatment of other guests, physical or verbal abuse, harassment, profanity, confrontation, intimidation, or threatening and irresponsible behavior

Unreasonably obstructing the view of other guests.

Failure to follow the directions of staff or law enforcement, including refusal to produce proof of ticket, valid event credential or refusal to submit to security screening inclusive of physical searches prior to entering.

Sitting in a location other than one’s ticketed seat, any unauthorized use of disabled seating areas, accessing spaces not permitted by one’s ticket, lingering in aisles, stairways, or unauthorized areas of the stadium.

Possession or consumption of illegal or prohibited drugs or substances.

Intoxication or other signs of alcohol impairment or substance impairment.

Smoking inside the stadium, including the use of vaporizers and e-cigarettes. In accordance with the Nevada Clean Air Indoor Act, Allegiant Stadium is a smoke-free facility. Designated smoking areas are located outside of the stadium.

Possession of any item listed on the ALLEGIANT STADIUM PROHIBITED ITEMS LIST.

All guests in attendance are required to wear clothing (i.e., shirt, pants, and shoes for safety). Nudity, partial nudity, body paint and pasties are prohibited. Any action deemed to be indecent exposure and/or clothing that is deemed offensive, obscene, or displays offensive text and/or images is prohibited. Allegiant Stadium management reserves the right to deny entry or eject guests based on these requirements.

There is no loitering or tailgating in stadium parking areas during or after the event. All stadium parking lots are cleared one hour after the end of the event.

Damage, destruction, vandalism, or theft of any property.

Failure to identify one’s self to stadium staff or law enforcement upon request.

Any action in violation of any local, state, or federal laws or NFL, Raiders, or Allegiant Stadium policies.

Guests that violate the Code of Conduct (i) may be required to take an online conduct course and pay a course fee in order to re-enter the stadium for future events and (ii) are subject to other penalties, including being trespassed from the stadium, and any additional action deemed necessary by law enforcement.

Allegiant Stadium Prohibited Items List

Allegiant Stadium offers wheelchair escort services for guests with disabilities. A wheelchair escort is available for guests who need to use an Allegiant Stadium wheelchair for assistance to and from the gate and the guest's seating location. Escort services are not available for guests who bring their own wheelchair or other mobility device to Allegiant Stadium, as Allegiant Stadium staff are not permitted to push guests in their own personal wheelchair. In addition, the escort service is strictly limited between the gate and the guest's seat inside Allegiant Stadium. Staff is not permitted to escort guests to the restrooms, concession stands, parking lots, or other areas in or around Allegiant Stadium. Wheelchair assistance must be requested onsite and is on a first come first serve basis. Please visit the nearest Guest Experience location within Allegiant Stadium to request a wheelchair escort.

We do not offer mobility device storage. Allegiant Stadium nor its employees are not responsible for mobility devices that are lost, stolen, or left in the possession of anyone other than it’s owner.
